metadata.title: CVE-2016-0764 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Race condition in Network Manager before 1.0.12 as packaged in Red HatEnterprise Linux Desktop 7, Red Hat Enterprise Linux HPC Node 7, Red HatEnterprise Linux Server 7, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation 7allows local users to obtain sensitive connection information by readingtemporary files during ifcfg and keyfile changes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnm-glib4 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnm-util2 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libnm0 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
network-manager - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: network-manager package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
